context_bundle.summary: Clickjacking prevention: Attacker overlays invisible iframe to trick users into clicking. Defense: X-Frame-Options header (DENY or SAMEORIGIN), Content-Security-Policy frame-ancestors directive (modern replacement), JavaScript frame-busting (legacy fallback). CSP frame-ancestors 'self' is the recommended modern approach.

onboarding.quick_start: Clickjacking defense: 1) Set X-Frame-Options: DENY (or SAMEORIGIN if framing needed), 2) Set CSP frame-ancestors 'self' (preferred modern method), 3) Add frame-busting JavaScript as fallback for legacy browsers.
common_patterns: X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN (only same origin can frame)
Frame busting: if (top !== self) { top.location = self.location; }

known_errors.error: Page can be framed by malicious site
known_errors.cause: Missing X-Frame-Options or CSP frame-ancestors header
known_errors.solution: Add header: X-Frame-Options: DENY or CSP: frame-ancestors 'none'
known_errors.prevention: Security headers middleware applied globally to all responses

known_errors.error: Frame busting bypassed by sandbox attribute
known_errors.cause: JavaScript frame-busting can be defeated by iframe sandbox
known_errors.solution: Use HTTP headers (X-Frame-Options/CSP) which cannot be bypassed
known_errors.prevention: Never rely solely on JavaScript for security controls
